definitions.definition: To cause (something) to cease to be in one's possession or capability due to unfortunate or unknown circumstances, events or reasons.
definitions.example: He lost his hearing in the explosion.

definitions.definition: To wander from; to miss, so as not to be able to find; to go astray from.
definitions.example: I lost my way in the forest.

definitions.definition: To fail to win (a game, competition, trial, etc).
To be unable to follow or trace (somebody or something) any longer.
definitions.example: Mission control lost the satellite as its signal died down.

definitions.definition: To cause (somebody) to be unable to follow or trace one any longer.
definitions.example: We managed to lose our pursuers in the forest.

definitions.definition: To cease exhibiting; to overcome (a behavior or emotion).
To shed, remove, discard, or eliminate.
definitions.example: When we get into the building, please lose the hat.

definitions.definition: Of a clock, to run slower than expected.
definitions.example: It's already 5:30? My watch must have lost a few minutes.

definitions.definition: (ditransitive) To cause (someone) the loss of something; to deprive of.
To fail to catch with the mind or senses; to miss.
definitions.example: I lost a part of what he said.

definitions.definition: To cause to part with; to deprive of.
Having wandered from, or unable to find, the way.
definitions.example: The children were soon lost in the forest.

definitions.definition: In an unknown location; unable to be found.
definitions.example: Deep beneath the ocean, the Titanic was lost to the world.

definitions.definition: Not perceptible to the senses; no longer visible.
definitions.example: an island lost in a fog; a person lost in a crowd

definitions.definition: Parted with; no longer held or possessed.
Not employed or enjoyed; thrown away; employed ineffectually; wasted; squandered.
definitions.example: a lost day; a lost opportunity or benefit

definitions.definition: Ruined or destroyed, either physically or morally; past help or hope.
definitions.example: a ship lost at sea; a woman lost to virtue; a lost soul

definitions.definition: Hardened beyond sensibility or recovery; alienated; insensible.
definitions.example: lost to shame; lost to all sense of honour

definitions.definition: Occupied with, or under the influence of, something, so as not to notice external things.
